abstract: Twitter is not profitable, while Facebook was when it went public. But Twitter’s revenue is growing faster.
snippet: Twitter is not profitable, while Facebook was when it went public. But Twitter’s revenue is growing faster.
lead_paragraph: Twitter’s immature market debut leaves plenty of room for investors’ animal spirits. Early disorganization and a late focus on the top line make the microblogging service seem younger than Facebook was when it went public. Facebook was profitable, while Twitter is in the red — but its revenue is growing faster than Facebook’s.

byline.original: By Robert Cyran and Richard Beales
